text: 14.13 The Characterisation and Growth Study (2023) takes a more granular approach and characterises the specific building typologies of small areas of the borough. It then assesses them for coherence, design quality, and sensitivity to change, and determines their capacity for growth – set out for each area as ‘conserve’ ‘enhance’, or ‘transform’, as shown on figure 9. The capacity for growth as set out in this document does not determine what development should be proposed on a site, and does not imply that there are areas where no development would be possible. Instead, it is a starting point for a design-led process, allowing for consideration of what would be the most appropriate form within each area.
